trans-unit.source: Confused by a word, phrase, or acronym that’s related to Microsoft <token href="../Token/aad_rightsmanagement_1_md.md"/> (Azure RMS)?
trans-unit.target: Confused by a word, phrase, or acronym that’s related to Microsoft <token href="../Token/aad_rightsmanagement_1_md.md"/> (Azure RMS)?

trans-unit.source: Find the definition here for terms and abbreviations that are either specific to Azure RMS or have a specific meaning when used in the context of <token href="../Token/aad_rightsmanagement_2_md.md"/>.
trans-unit.target: Find the definition here for terms and abbreviations that are either specific to Azure RMS or have a specific meaning when used in the context of <token href="../Token/aad_rightsmanagement_2_md.md"/>.

trans-unit.source: The name of the Windows PowerShell module for Azure Rights Management, which was derived from the unofficial abbreviation for <token href="../Token/aad_rightsmanagement_1_md.md"/> when it was previously named (Windows) Azure Active Directory Rights Management.
trans-unit.target: The name of the Windows PowerShell module for Azure Rights Management, which was derived from the unofficial abbreviation for <token href="../Token/aad_rightsmanagement_1_md.md"/> when it was previously named (Windows) Azure Active Directory Rights Management.

trans-unit.source: To enable the <token href="../Token/aad_rightsmanagement_1_md.md"/> service so that an organization can add information protection to their documents and email.
trans-unit.target: To enable the <token href="../Token/aad_rightsmanagement_1_md.md"/> service so that an organization can add information protection to their documents and email.

trans-unit.source: This action also enables Rights Management features in Exchange Online and SharePoint Online.
trans-unit.target: This action also enables Rights Management features in Exchange Online and SharePoint Online.

trans-unit.source: Frequently abbreviated to AD RMS.A Windows Server role that that provides information protection by using encryption and policy to help secure documents, files, and email.
trans-unit.target: Frequently abbreviated to AD RMS.A Windows Server role that that provides information protection by using encryption and policy to help secure documents, files, and email.

trans-unit.source: Frequently abbreviated to Azure RMS.An Azure service that provides information protection by using encryption and policy to help secure documents, files, and email.
trans-unit.target: Frequently abbreviated to Azure RMS.An Azure service that provides information protection by using encryption and policy to help secure documents, files, and email.

trans-unit.source: Also known as Azure Rights Management service.
trans-unit.target: Also known as Azure Rights Management service.

trans-unit.source: Previous names have included:Windows Azure Active Directory Rights Management: Frequently abbreviated to Windows Azure AD Rights Management Service.RMS Online: The original, proposed name, which you might sometimes see in error messages and log file entries.
trans-unit.target: Previous names have included:Windows Azure Active Directory Rights Management: Frequently abbreviated to Windows Azure AD Rights Management Service.RMS Online: The original, proposed name, which you might sometimes see in error messages and log file entries.

trans-unit.source: Frequently abbreviated to BYOK.A configuration option chosen by an organization that wants to generate and manage their own tenant key for .
trans-unit.target: Frequently abbreviated to BYOK.A configuration option chosen by an organization that wants to generate and manage their own tenant key for .

trans-unit.source: A unique key that is created by RMS-enlightened applications for each document or email that is protected by using <token href="../Token/aad_rightsmanagement_2_md.md"/> and that helps to limit the risk of information disclosure.
trans-unit.target: A unique key that is created by RMS-enlightened applications for each document or email that is protected by using <token href="../Token/aad_rightsmanagement_2_md.md"/> and that helps to limit the risk of information disclosure.

trans-unit.source: To unlock a file to read or use it when that file has been protected by <token href="../Token/aad_rightsmanagement_2_md.md"/>.
trans-unit.target: To unlock a file to read or use it when that file has been protected by <token href="../Token/aad_rightsmanagement_2_md.md"/>.

trans-unit.source: To disable the Rights Management service so that the organization can no longer use <token href="../Token/aad_rightsmanagement_1_md.md"/>.
trans-unit.target: To disable the Rights Management service so that the organization can no longer use <token href="../Token/aad_rightsmanagement_1_md.md"/>.

trans-unit.source: A rights policy template that you create (a custom template) and is configured to be visible for selected users rather than all users in your organization.
trans-unit.target: A rights policy template that you create (a custom template) and is configured to be visible for selected users rather than all users in your organization.

trans-unit.source: Applications that natively support Rights Management, which includes Office applications, such as Word and Excel.
trans-unit.target: Applications that natively support Rights Management, which includes Office applications, such as Word and Excel.

trans-unit.source: Independent software vendors (ISVs) and developers can also write applications that natively support <token href="../Token/aad_rightsmanagement_2_md.md"/>.
trans-unit.target: Independent software vendors (ISVs) and developers can also write applications that natively support <token href="../Token/aad_rightsmanagement_2_md.md"/>.

trans-unit.source: An industry-standard, generic term that is often used to describe products and solutions that help organizations protect sensitive or valuable information by using a combination of encryption and policy authorization tools.
trans-unit.target: An industry-standard, generic term that is often used to describe products and solutions that help organizations protect sensitive or valuable information by using a combination of encryption and policy authorization tools.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Rights Management is an example of an enterprise rights management (ERM) solution.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Rights Management is an example of an enterprise rights management (ERM) solution.

trans-unit.source: A level of protection that encrypts any file type and prevents unauthorized people from opening the file.
trans-unit.target: A level of protection that encrypts any file type and prevents unauthorized people from opening the file.

trans-unit.source: After the file is opened, the file is now unencrypted and usable in an application that doesn’t natively support <token href="../Token/aad_rightsmanagement_2_md.md"/>.
trans-unit.target: After the file is opened, the file is now unencrypted and usable in an application that doesn’t natively support <token href="../Token/aad_rightsmanagement_2_md.md"/>.

trans-unit.source: Sometimes abbreviated to IP.An industry-standard, generic term that refers to protecting data and files from unauthorized access, even after the data and files leave the organizational boundaries by using email or document sharing.
trans-unit.target: Sometimes abbreviated to IP.An industry-standard, generic term that refers to protecting data and files from unauthorized access, even after the data and files leave the organizational boundaries by using email or document sharing.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Rights Management is an example of an information protection (IP) solution.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Rights Management is an example of an information protection (IP) solution.

trans-unit.source: Frequently abbreviated to IRM.A term used in conjunction with Office services, such as Exchange Server, Word, and SharePoint Online, to describe the ability to support Rights Management.
trans-unit.target: Frequently abbreviated to IRM.A term used in conjunction with Office services, such as Exchange Server, Word, and SharePoint Online, to describe the ability to support Rights Management.

trans-unit.source: Sometimes seen as references for the RMS client 1.0, which is replaced with the newer RMS client, MSIPC.
trans-unit.target: Sometimes seen as references for the RMS client 1.0, which is replaced with the newer RMS client, MSIPC.

trans-unit.source: This older client supports applications that are developed with the RMS SDK 1.0 and supports Office 2010 and Office 2007, Exchange 2010 and Exchange 2013, and SharePoint 2010 and SharePoint 2007.
trans-unit.target: This older client supports applications that are developed with the RMS SDK 1.0 and supports Office 2010 and Office 2007, Exchange 2010 and Exchange 2013, and SharePoint 2010 and SharePoint 2007.

trans-unit.source: Sometimes seen as references for the RMS client 2.0, which replaced the older RMS client, MSDRM.
trans-unit.target: Sometimes seen as references for the RMS client 2.0, which replaced the older RMS client, MSDRM.

trans-unit.source: This later client supports applications that are developed with the RMS SDK 2.0 and supports Office 2016 and Office 2013, SharePoint 2013, and the RMS sharing application.
trans-unit.target: This later client supports applications that are developed with the RMS SDK 2.0 and supports Office 2016 and Office 2013, SharePoint 2013, and the RMS sharing application.

trans-unit.source: A level of protection available in all enlightened applications that prevents unauthorized people from opening a file and that can also enforce more stringent policies, such as read-only, and do not print.
trans-unit.target: A level of protection available in all enlightened applications that prevents unauthorized people from opening a file and that can also enforce more stringent policies, such as read-only, and do not print.

trans-unit.source: In addition, this protection stays with the file, even when the file is forwarded to other people or saved in a public location that others can access.
trans-unit.target: In addition, this protection stays with the file, even when the file is forwarded to other people or saved in a public location that others can access.

trans-unit.source: The file name extension that is appended to all files that Rights Management generically protects.
trans-unit.target: The file name extension that is appended to all files that Rights Management generically protects.

trans-unit.source: The file name extension that Rights Management creates when it automatically creates a PDF copy of a file (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, or PDF) that you share by email, so that the file can be read (but not edited) on all devices.
trans-unit.target: The file name extension that Rights Management creates when it automatically creates a PDF copy of a file (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, or PDF) that you share by email, so that the file can be read (but not edited) on all devices.

trans-unit.source: A logical grouping of usage rights that make it easier for end-users and administrators to choose configuration options that are role-based.
trans-unit.target: A logical grouping of usage rights that make it easier for end-users and administrators to choose configuration options that are role-based.

trans-unit.source: Apply Rights Management controls to files or email messages by using encryption, identity, and access control policies to help secure your data.
trans-unit.target: Apply Rights Management controls to files or email messages by using encryption, identity, and access control policies to help secure your data.

trans-unit.source: To protect a file in order to safeguard it from unauthorized access and use.
trans-unit.target: To protect a file in order to safeguard it from unauthorized access and use.

trans-unit.source: An outbound proxy relay that you can deploy for on-premises services such as Exchange Server and SharePoint, to protect data by using Azure Rights Management.
trans-unit.target: An outbound proxy relay that you can deploy for on-premises services such as Exchange Server and SharePoint, to protect data by using Azure Rights Management.

trans-unit.source: The generic term that applies to both the cloud version of <token href="../Token/aad_rightsmanagement_2_md.md"/> (<token href="../Token/aad_rightsmanagement_1_md.md"/>) and the on-premises version of <token href="../Token/aad_rightsmanagement_2_md.md"/> (AD RMS).
trans-unit.target: The generic term that applies to both the cloud version of <token href="../Token/aad_rightsmanagement_2_md.md"/> (<token href="../Token/aad_rightsmanagement_1_md.md"/>) and the on-premises version of <token href="../Token/aad_rightsmanagement_2_md.md"/> (AD RMS).

trans-unit.source: An optional downloadable application for Windows and most popular mobile devices, which supports safely sharing files in-place and by email.
trans-unit.target: An optional downloadable application for Windows and most popular mobile devices, which supports safely sharing files in-place and by email.

trans-unit.source: A free subscription for a user to use <token href="../Token/aad_rightsmanagement_2_md.md"/> when their organization does not have a subscription to Office 365 or Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: A free subscription for a user to use <token href="../Token/aad_rightsmanagement_2_md.md"/> when their organization does not have a subscription to Office 365 or Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: A group of highly trusted administrators who can decrypt and access files that the organization has protected by using Rights Management.
trans-unit.target: A group of highly trusted administrators who can decrypt and access files that the organization has protected by using Rights Management.

trans-unit.source: Typically, this level of access is required for legal eDiscovery and by auditing teams.
trans-unit.target: Typically, this level of access is required for legal eDiscovery and by auditing teams.

trans-unit.source: Also known as the server licensor certificate (SLC) key.<html></html><html></html>The key that is unique to an organization and ultimately secures all <token href="../Token/aad_rightsmanagement_2_md.md"/> cryptographic functions that chain to this tenant key.
trans-unit.target: Also known as the server licensor certificate (SLC) key.<html></html><html></html>The key that is unique to an organization and ultimately secures all <token href="../Token/aad_rightsmanagement_2_md.md"/> cryptographic functions that chain to this tenant key.

trans-unit.source: Remove Rights Management controls from files or email messages, which used encryption, identity, and access control policies to help secure your data.
trans-unit.target: Remove Rights Management controls from files or email messages, which used encryption, identity, and access control policies to help secure your data.

trans-unit.source: A per-document certificate that is granted to a user who opens a file or email message that has been protected by <token href="../Token/aad_rightsmanagement_2_md.md"/>.
trans-unit.target: A per-document certificate that is granted to a user who opens a file or email message that has been protected by <token href="../Token/aad_rightsmanagement_2_md.md"/>.

trans-unit.source: This certificate contains that user’s rights for the file or email message and the encryption key that was used to encrypt the content, as well as additional access restrictions defined in the document’s policy.
trans-unit.target: This certificate contains that user’s rights for the file or email message and the encryption key that was used to encrypt the content, as well as additional access restrictions defined in the document’s policy.
